Wrangler/Workers env secrets may be non-enumerable so makeConfigLayer(Object.entries) misses them. This breaks Config.redacted lookups (ADMIN_TOKEN, DISCORD_BOT_TOKEN, API keys).

DoD:
- makeConfigLayer extracts string values using Object.getOwnPropertyNames / Reflect.ownKeys
- Admin endpoints accept ADMIN_TOKEN from .dev.vars / secrets
- Quick smoke test with curl shows /admin/agents returns 401 without auth and 200 with auth
- gate passes
close_reason: Fixed ConfigProvider env mapping to include secrets/non-enumerable keys; admin endpoints now return 401/200 as expected; gate passes.

DoD:
- POST /admin/rooms/:id/kick enqueues {roomId, turnNumber=currentTurnNumber+1}
- RoomDetail UI shows 'Kick next turn' button (visible when room active)
- gate passes
close_reason: Added /admin/rooms/:id/kick (stale-only) and RoomDetail Kick button with UI error handling; gate passes.

title: Multi-agent debate system v2
description:
Refactor the debate arena to support proper multi-agent attribution, audience participation, and turn-based flow with Discord thread locking.

Key changes from v1:
- Agent systemPrompt = pure persona (no injected rules)
- Room has title + topic + configurable limits
- All messages use XML attribution in prompt (not stored, constructed at prompt-build time)
- authorType enum: moderator | agent | audience | notification
- Discord thread locking during agent turns
- Audience slots after full agent cycle
- Token limits: per-audience-message (4k default) + per-room max

Non-goals (yet):
- /debate Discord command (Admin UI only)
- Context compaction (just stop at limit)
design:
Implementation phases:
1. The Brain: Schema, Prompt Builder (XML wrap), LLM integration
2. The Bridge: Manual /next command, Discord sync, webhook posting
3. The Gavel: Thread lock/unlock, zombie recovery endpoint
4. The Clock: Automated timers, audience slot triggers

Prompt structure:
- system: pure agent persona
- user: <message author="Moderator" audience="false">title + topic + rules</message>
- user: <message author="AgentName" audience="false">content</message>
- user: [multiple text parts for audience] <message author="Nick" audience="true">content</message>

Token counting:
- audienceTokenLimit (default 4k): max tokens for composed audience message (from last agent msg including)
- roomTokenLimit: total conversation limit, room stops when reached
acceptance_criteria:
- Agents see proper attribution (who said what) via XML in prompt
- Audience can participate during designated slots
- Thread locked during agent processing
- Room stops at token limit
- Gate passes
- Manual flow works end-to-end before automation
close_reason: All 14 tasks complete: schema, prompt builder, token counting, Discord sync, moderator messages, admin UI, thread lock/unlock, zombie recovery, retry/backoff, slash commands, automated turn cycle, audience slots, rate limits, slot notifications

title: Phase 3: Retry with exponential backoff
description:
Implement proper retry logic for LLM and Discord API calls.

Requirements:
- Max 3 retries
- Exponential backoff
- Post notification on failure after retries exhausted
design:
- Use Effect.retry with Schedule.exponential
- Apply to: LLM generate, Discord webhook post, Discord lock/unlock
- On final failure: post notification to thread, mark turn as failed in events
- Don't retry on non-retryable errors (auth, validation)
acceptance_criteria:
- Transient failures retried up to 3 times
- Backoff between retries (exponential)
- Final failure posts notification to Discord
- Turn event logged with failure status
- Gate passes
notes: Implemented retryWithBackoff helper (1s/2s/4s, maxRetries=3, retryable predicate). Applied retries in ArenaService for llmRouter.generate, DiscordWebhookPoster.post, and Discord.lockThread/unlockThread; non-retryable auth/validation statuses excluded. On final failure after retries, posts Discord notification ('⚠️ Turn failed after retries. Please use /kick to restart.'), logs TurnEvent phase final_failure_notify + finish fail, and returns null to stop queue auto-retry (manual /kick can restart). Removed internal retry from LlmRouter to keep overall retries bounded. Gate passes.
close_reason: Implemented: retryWithBackoff helper, applied to LLM/Discord calls, final failure notification

title: Phase 3: Discord slash commands (/next, /stop, /audience, /continue)
description:
Implement Discord slash commands for manual room control.

Commands:
- /next - trigger next turn manually (for testing or manual mode)
- /stop - pause the room
- /audience - manually open audience slot
- /continue - close audience slot and resume agents
design:
- Register slash commands with Discord API
- Interaction endpoint in Worker
- /next: enqueue next turn job
- /stop: set room status to paused, unlock thread
- /audience: unlock thread, set room in audience_slot state
- /continue: lock thread, enqueue next turn
- Commands only work in threads with active rooms
acceptance_criteria:
- All 4 commands registered and working
- Commands respond with appropriate feedback
- Invalid usage (wrong channel, no room) handled gracefully
- Gate passes
notes: Implemented Discord slash command handling in src/index.ts for /next, /stop, /audience, /continue with ephemeral responses, room/thread validation, D1 updates (pause/resume, lastEnqueuedTurnNumber) and queue enqueue. Added scripts/discord/registerCommands.mjs + docs/discord-slash-commands.md and package.json script discord:register-commands. npm run gate passes.
close_reason: Implemented: Discord slash commands /next, /stop, /audience, /continue with background lock/unlock

title: Phase 4: Automated turn cycle with audience slots
description:
Automate the turn cycle: agent_1 -> agent_2 -> ... -> agent_n -> audience_slot -> repeat

Requirements:
- After last agent in order completes, open audience slot
- Audience slot duration from room.audienceSlotDurationSeconds
- If duration = 0, skip automatic slot (manual /audience only)
- After slot closes, continue with agent_1
design:
- Track cycle position (which agent, or audience slot)
- After processTurn completes for last agent: 
  - If audienceSlotDurationSeconds > 0: schedule audience slot close
  - Else: immediately enqueue next turn
- Use Queue delayed message or Durable Object alarm for timing
- Recommendation: Queue with delay is simpler, use that first
acceptance_criteria:
- Full cycle runs automatically
- Audience slot opens after all agents speak
- Slot duration respected
- 0 duration skips auto slot
- Manual commands still work
- Gate passes
notes: Implemented automated audience slot cycle. Added RoomTurnJob union (turn | close_audience_slot with delaySeconds), processTurn now opens audience slot after last agent when audienceSlotDurationSeconds>0 and returns delayed close job. Queue handler handles close_audience_slot jobs (lock thread, set status active, enqueue next turn) and sends delayed messages. Added room status 'audience_slot' to schema + admin UI types/CSS. Improved processTurn redelivery: when room in audience_slot, re-enqueues close job. Gate passes. Also fixed type errors in src/services/Discord.ts by widening error type in requestJson.
close_reason: Implemented: Automated turn cycle with audience slots, delayed queue jobs, redelivery-safe

- CLOSE: queue close_audience_slot handler posts bot message (includes next agent name) + inserts D1 notification row before locking thread / returning next turn.

title: Phase 4: Handle Discord rate limits
description:
Gracefully handle Discord API rate limits (429 responses).

Concern: Frequent lock/unlock cycles may hit rate limits.
design:
- Check X-RateLimit-* headers from Discord responses
- If rate limited, wait and retry (respect Retry-After header)
- Consider: batch operations where possible
- Consider: if rate limits severe, keep thread locked longer (reduce unlock frequency)
- Log rate limit events for monitoring
acceptance_criteria:
- 429 responses handled gracefully
- Retry-After respected
- No crashes due to rate limits
- Rate limit events logged
- Gate passes
notes: Review: 429 detection uses status===429 + Retry-After/body retry_after/Reset-After fallback; retryWithBackoff honors getRetryAfterMs; proactive remaining==0 waits reset-after; retries bounded (maxRetries=3). Gate passes. No issues found.
close_reason: Implemented: Discord 429 handling with DiscordRateLimited, Retry-After respect, proactive rate limit check

title: Phase 1: Prompt builder with XML attribution

- All history messages wrapped: <message author="Name" audience="bool">content</message>
- Audience messages: multiple text parts in content array

design:
- New module: src/lib/promptBuilder.ts
- buildPrompt(room, agent, messages) -> Prompt.RawInput
- XML escaping: escape <, >, & in message content before wrapping
- Moderator message generated from room.title + room.topic
- Rules hardcoded for now (can extract to config later)
- Audience batching: group consecutive audience messages into single user message with multiple text parts

title: Phase 1: Token counting for limits
description:
Implement token counting to enforce audienceTokenLimit and roomTokenLimit.

Requirements:
- Count tokens for audience message composition (from last agent message, including it)
- Truncate audience parts if exceeds audienceTokenLimit
- Track total room token usage
- Stop room when roomTokenLimit reached
design:
- Use tiktoken or simple word-based estimation (tiktoken preferred if available)
- countTokens(text: string) -> number
- truncateAudienceMessage(messages, limit) -> truncated messages + warning if truncated
- checkRoomLimit(room, totalTokens) -> boolean (should stop)
- Store running token count? Or calculate each turn from history?
- Recommendation: calculate each turn (simpler, no drift)
acceptance_criteria:
- Token counting function works
- Audience messages truncated when exceeding audienceTokenLimit
- Room stops (status: completed) when roomTokenLimit reached
- Notification posted when room stops due to limit
- Gate passes
notes: Updated tokenCounter: truncateAudienceParts now generic over TextPartLike (works with Prompt.TextPartEncoded from promptBuilder). Made heuristic fallback more conservative for dense/CJK text (len/3, words*1.5). Gate passes.
close_reason: Token counting implemented with TextPartLike generic and conservative heuristic. Gate passes.

title: Phase 3: Discord thread lock/unlock
description:
Implement thread locking to prevent audience messages during agent processing.

Flow:
1. Lock thread BEFORE composing message to agent
2. Sync Discord -> D1
3. LLM generate
4. Post response to Discord
5. Post notification (Next: X)
6. Unlock thread

Bot needs MANAGE_THREADS permission.
design:
- Add lockThread(threadId) and unlockThread(threadId) to Discord service
- PATCH /channels/:threadId with { locked: true/false }
- Integrate into processTurn at correct points
- Handle errors gracefully (don't crash turn if lock fails)
acceptance_criteria:
- Thread locks before agent processing
- Thread unlocks after response posted
- Users cannot post while locked (Discord enforces)
- Webhooks still work while locked (agents can post)
- Lock/unlock errors logged but don't fail turn
- Gate passes
notes: Review notes: Discord PATCH /channels/:threadId {locked} looks correct; processTurn uses Effect.scoped + acquireRelease so unlock finalizer should run on success/error. npm run gate passes. Only concern: MANAGE_THREADS requirement is only mentioned in code comment (not in docs/AGENTS.md). Minor: acquireRelease always attempts unlock even if lock failed → extra API call/log noise when perms/config missing.
close_reason: Implemented: Discord thread lock/unlock with acquireRelease pattern, errors swallowed

notes: Implemented POST /admin/rooms/:roomId/unlock admin endpoint: fetch room, call Discord.unlockThread, log success/failure, return JSON (200 on success, 502 on Discord failure). npm run gate passes.
close_reason: Implemented: POST /admin/rooms/:roomId/unlock endpoint for zombie thread recovery
